SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 7th JUNE 1918.
1. There is no change in the general situation, 320 prisoners and 7 machine guns were captured by the French in their counter-attack in the neighbourhood of VEUILLY-LA-POTERIE.
The Germans carried out a local attack between CHAMPLAT and ST.EUPHRAISE and captured the village of BLIGNY. A counter-attack is being prepared to retake this village.
Considerable aerial activity and movement are reported on the NOYON - MONTDIDIER front.
2. On the British front a party of our troops raided a hostile post last night, north of BETHUNE, and after inflicting casualties on the garrison and capturing a machine gun, returned, without loss to themselves.
For the personal information -of the Minister only. -
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
7th June, 1918.
Issued at 12.50 p.m.
